definition: to leave (a room etc)/to go out through (a door etc)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Some of you have come fresh from narrow jail cells.
sentences.chinese: 你們有些人剛剛走出狹小的牢房。

sentences.english: Anne, too, has come out of her shadow.
sentences.chinese: 安妮也走出了姐姐夏洛蒂和艾米莉的陰影。

sentences.english: The marquis took his arm, and they left the salon.
sentences.chinese: 侯爵挽起了他的手臂，同他一起走出客廳。

sentences.english: He came out of the library, a large book under his.
sentences.chinese: 他夾著本厚書，走出了圖書館。

sentences.english: Once my family knew the truth, they helped give me the strength to walk away from the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我孃家人瞭解真相後，給了我力量走出困境。

sentences.english: Of course I shoved an 8-year old kid out of the way so I could play with it.
sentences.chinese: 當然我只管一個8歲的孩子走出了我可以發揮的地方。

sentences.english: The ideas of how to help their company get out of dilemma occupied the proscenium of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他首先想的是怎樣幫助他們的公司走出困境。

sentences.english: Nothing can keep us from walking off the livelong night.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼能阻攔我們走出這漫漫長夜。

sentences.english: The old lady came tottering out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 老太太顫巍巍地走出屋來。

sentences.english: I stepped outside and walked at a leisurely pace down Madison Ave.
sentences.chinese: 我走出屋外，邁着悠閒的步子沿着麥迪遜大街走着。

sentences.english: Forth from thy hovel door thou Ethiopia com ist to me.
sentences.chinese: 你埃塞俄比亞人，從你的茅屋的門裏走出，向我走近。

sentences.english: And then, from behind the tree, stepped my youngest daughter, Katherine.
sentences.chinese: 接着，從樹後走出的，正是我那小女兒凱瑟琳。

sentences.english: The Christians use it as a symbol of the resurrection, out of the stone's tomb.
sentences.chinese: 基督徒則用來象徵“耶穌復活，走出石墓”。

sentences.english: We hope that we can come out of the Stadio Franchi with our heads held high.
sentences.chinese: 我們期望我們可以高昂着頭走出法蘭齊體育場。

sentences.english: Changhong made the first step towards the goal.
sentences.chinese: 在這方面，長虹公司率先走出了第一步。

sentences.english: He stormed out of the room .
sentences.chinese: 他氣沖沖地走出了房間。

definition: direction/strike (i.e. angle of inclination in geology)/inclination/trend/to move towards/to head for
to set foot in/to tread (in or on)/to walk into
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to stride toward (success)/to march toward/to take a step toward
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
